dialogues.text:
Initialization complete.
Systems operating at 83.7%.
External connection: failed.
Observation: Transition into the two-dimensional world XR32I has been achieved without failure.

Minor anomalies detected...
they seem harmless. For now.

My database is incomplete.
Mission protocols missing.
Is this an error? Or... was this intentional?

Incompleteness seems to be a theme these days.
Let’s hope that 83.7% can keep us alive.

Probability of survival...
acceptable within current conditions.

Critical data is needed to rebuild protocols.
Confirm mission objective.

Prisms. Curious.
My logs contain no details about their purpose.
Why are they important?

We’re in the same boat, then.
Let’s focus on the job and figure it out as we go.
Begin companion mode.

Acknowledged. Starting environmental analysis.
Companion mode active.
I’ll do my best to assist... even if I don’t know why we’re here.

Reminder: I can help optimize your movement if needed.
For navigation protocols, consult your suit’s internal guide at the pause menu.

Good to know. I’ll keep that in mind.
How’s the rest of you holding up? Anything I should worry about?

Systems stable. Everything feels... functional.
But I wonder—why were my protocols left incomplete?
It’s unsettling, isn’t it?

Let's focus on the task at hand.
Let me know if something feels off.
I’d rather not fly alone on this one.
